summary: social media monitoring and pathogen whole genome sequencing (WGS) will enhance communicable disease surveillance research and systems. if linked electronically and scanned systematically, the information provided by these technologies could be mined to uncover new epidemiological patterns and associations much faster than traditional public health approaches. the benefits of earlier outbreak detection are significant, but implementation could be opposed in the absence of a social licence. article contains supplementary material available to authorized users. additional files Additional file 1 (10.5MB, docx) Table S1. Participant characteristics.
